'''Eärnil I''' ({{TA|736}}<ref name=Elendil>{{PM|Elendil}}, manuscript C with corrections and expansions, The Southern Line of Gondor: the Anarioni, 13. Earnil I</ref> – {{TA|936|n}},<ref>{{App|South}}, ''Kings of Gondor'', Eärnil I</ref> aged 200 years) was the thirteenth [[King of Gondor]] and the second [[Ship-king]].<ref>{{App|South}}, ''Kings of Gondor''</ref>

==History==
Eärnil was the son of [[Tarciryan]], the brother of King [[Tarannon Falastur]]. He succeeded his uncle [[Tarannon Falastur]], who died childless in {{TA|913}}.<ref>{{App|South}}, ''Kings of Gondor'', Tarannon Falastur</ref> He continued with the expansionist maritime policy of his predecessor by repairing the haven of [[Pelargir]] and building a great fleet. Eärnil besieged [[Umbar]] by land and by sea and conquered Umbar<ref name=Earnil>{{App|Gondor}}, entry for Eärnil</ref> in {{TA|933}}.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 933</ref> Umbar became a great haven and fortress of Gondor. Eärnil died together with many men in a great storm off Umbar, in which many ships sank.<ref name=Earnil/> He was succeeded by his son<ref>{{App|Gondor}}, entry for Ciryandil</ref> [[Ciryandil]].<ref>{{App|South}}, ''Kings of Gondor'', Ciryandil</ref>

==Etymology==
''Eärnil'' is a [[Quenya]] name. It is a shortened form of ''[[Eärendil]]''.<ref>{{PE|17}}, p. 152</ref>
